I'm fairly new to the LoL scene, but anyone who isn't sympathetic to this players loss of $2k Euro is beyond me.  I understand he has had multiple chances for toxic behavior and I don't condone it. but a permanent loss of his account doesn't seem right.  Investing that much to support in a game to have it all thrown out the window seems ludicrous.  Is he a pro player?  Does he represent Riot in an advertising environment?  Highly Doubt it since just a gold player.  This day and age of gaming are full of toxic players.  Maybe a 2-3 Month Ban, but don't punish somebody that severely to basically delete his account given he has put that money into your game.  I for one just put some money into the game to buy a few skins/champs, but this definitely makes me think twice on how much I wanna gamble.  I'm not a toxic player, I hardly speak in-game except for certain calls, but there are those few players where you just wanna smash your face on your keyboard and speak your mind.  Just seems a little overboard by nullifying his contribution to Riot.  Just my 2 Cents.  Thanks for reading.

It's not that people don't feel sympathetic for his loss of money, it's that spending money on a game is no excuse for spending your time treating other people poorly in that game.  League of Legends is a free to play game, you are not required to spend any money unless you want additional/optional content in the form of cosmetic alterations. We're all here to play a game and have fun, some of us choose to support the game by spending money, others do not.  But spending money does not make you a more valuable player to Riot.  Riot is here providing us a service, and their job includes ensuring to the best of their ability that the general player base can enjoy this service without feeling threatened or abused.  If that means they need to remove access to players causing emotional harm and stress intentionally to other players, than that is what they have to do in order to provide a healthier environment for their game, despite any amount of money they could have gotten from that banned player.  

On top of this spending money does not give someone the right to intentionally cause stress or emotionally abuse other people, you are given every opportunity to read the Terms of Service that you "Accept" in order to play this game.  Upon clicking that button you have agreed that you have read and fully understand those rules and that you will follow them.  Ignorance to these rules is in itself a violation of them since you agreed that you were aware of them.  

Ultimately nobody is perfect, people make mistakes and sometimes our emotions get the better of us.  Riot understands this and that is why the reform system exists at all.  If you receive even a single chat restriction you need to stop and realize that what you are doing is not appropriate and you need to make sure that you are actively trying to be a better person if you want to continue playing the game you enjoy.
